revised_title: Discovery of Milk Dentition in Orycteropus
tldr: The author discovered the presence of a milk dentition in the Aardvark (Orycteropus), a mammal with a unique and complex dentition system. The milk teeth are rudimentary and functionless but are completely calcified and distinguishable from the permanent teeth. This discovery sheds light on the Aardvark's evolutionary and systematic position within the mammal family tree.
